metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Getting Started
Change Platform:
Get Started with Git
Now that Git is installed, and it knows who you are, you can start using Git.
content.html: Now that Git is installed, and it knows who you are, you can start using Git.

content.text: Lets create our first repository
Key Steps to Get Started
Creating Git Folder
Start by creating a new folder for our project:
content.html: Start by creating a new folder for our project:

content.code_html:
mkdir myproject
cd myproject

content.text: mkdir creates a new directory.
content.html: mkdir creates a new directory.

content.text: cd changes our working directory.
content.html: cd changes our working directory.

content.text: Now we are in the correct directory and can initialize Git!
content.html: Now we are in the correct directory and can initialize Git!

content.text: Note: Open Git Bash Here (Windows)
If you're using Windows, you can open Git Bash directly in your project folder:
content.html: If you're using Windows, you can open Git Bash directly in your project folder:

content.text: This opens a terminal window in the correct location.
content.html: This opens a terminal window in the correct location.

content.text: Initialize Git
Now that we are in the correct folder, we can initialize Git on that folder:
content.html: Now that we are in the correct folder, we can initialize Git on that folder:

content.code:
git
init
Initialized empty Git repository in /Users/user/myproject/.git/
content.code_html:
git init 
Initialized empty Git repository in /Users/user/myproject/.git/

content.text: You just created your first Git Repository!
content.html: You just created your first Git Repository!

content.text: What is a Repository?
A Git repository is a folder that Git tracks for changes.
content.html: A Git repository is a folder that Git tracks for changes.

content.text: The repository stores all your project's history and versions.
content.html: The repository stores all your project's history and versions.

content.text: What Happens When You Run git init ?
Git creates a hidden folder called .git inside your project.
content.html: Git creates a hidden folder called .git inside your project.

content.text: This is where Git stores all the information it needs to track your files and history.
content.html: This is where Git stores all the information it needs to track your files and history.

content.code_html:
ls -a
.  ..  .git

content.text: Troubleshooting
Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
